summary:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize this document about Swiss Prime Site in 3-5 sentences. Let me start by reading through the content carefully.

The main points seem to be that Swiss Prime Site AG is a major European real estate company with a significant portfolio value. The document mentions their real estate under management is around CHF 26 billion, with their own portfolio at CHF 13 billion, focusing on commercial and retail properties in Swiss cities. They also have a Services segment with subsidiaries like Swiss Prime Site Solutions and Jelmoli.

The history section talks about their founding in 1999 by pension funds, listing on the stock exchange in 2000, and various acquisitions over the years, like Swisscom's office buildings, Frey Group, Maag Holding, Jelmoli, Wincasa, and Akara Group. There's also mention of selling some assets like Tertianum and Wincasa.

The Real Estate section lists some completed projects, highlighting the Prime Tower in Zurich as one of the tallest. The Asset Management part mentions Swiss Prime Site Solutions managing assets, and the Management section lists the current executives.

So the key concepts are the company's size, portfolio details, history of acquisitions and sales, notable projects, and their structure with the Services segment. I need to condense this into a concise summary, making sure to include the main topic (Swiss Prime Site AG as a leading real estate company), key financial figures, their business segments, historical growth through acquisitions, and notable properties. Also, mention the management team briefly. Avoid minor details like specific years unless they're crucial. Check for clarity and that each sentence adds value without redundancy.
</think>

Swiss Prime Site AG is a leading European real estate company with a CHF 26 billion real estate portfolio, including CHF 13 billion in commercial and retail properties across Swiss metropolitan areas. The company, founded in 1999 and listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange, has expanded through strategic acquisitions like Swisscom’s office buildings, Frey Group, and Jelmoli, while also strengthening its Services segment via subsidiaries such as Swiss Prime Site Solutions. Notable projects include iconic buildings like the Prime Tower in Zurich, one of Switzerland’s tallest office structures. Recent developments include the sale of Wincasa and Tertianum, alongside ongoing asset management and development activities. The company is led by CEO René Zahnd and other key executives focused on maintaining its market position.

qa_pairs.chunk:
[S1] Swiss Prime Site


# Swiss Prime Site



**Swiss Prime Site AG** is one of the largest listed real estate companies in Europe. [S2] The fair value of the real estate under management is around CHF 26 billion. [S3] The portfolio of the company's own real estate has a value of around CHF 13 billion and consists primarily of commercial and retail properties in the most important Swiss metropolitan regions of the Central Plateau. [S4] In addition to the real estate investments, the Group companies Swiss Prime Site Solutions and Jelmoli make up the Services segment. [S5] ## History

The company was founded in 1999 by the pension funds of Credit Suisse and Siemens Switzerland and the then Winterthur Life (now Axa). [S6] Swiss Prime Site was listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange in April 2000. [S7] At the time, the real estate portfolio had a value of around CHF 500 million. [S8] In 2001, Swiss Prime Site bought a portfolio of office buildings from Swisscom. [S9] In 2003, it acquired the Frey Group and in 2004 Maag Holding AG. [S10] In 2009, the takeover of the stock listed Jelmoli Holding AG took place. [S11] In October 2012, Swiss Prime Site acquired Wincasa AG, a real estate service company in Switzerland, as well as the Tertianum Group. [S12] In 2019 Swiss Prime Site announced the sale of the Tertianum Group. [S13] At the end of 2021, Swiss Prime Site acquired the Akara Group to strengthen the Services segment. [S14] In March 2023, the sale of Wincasa to Implenia was announced. [S15] ## Real Estate

Completed construction projects: Espace Tourbillon Genf, Basler Messeturm, Opus Zug, the PostFinance Arena and Schönburg in Bern YOND , Sihlcity in Zürich and Roter Turm in Winterthur. [S16] as well as the Prime Tower with the Clouds restaurant and its neighboring building. [S17] The Prime Tower on the Maag site in Zürich West, is with its total of 126 meters, one of the tallest office buildings in Switzerland. [S18] ## Real Estate Asset Management

Swiss Prime Site Solutions manages assets. [S19] ## Management

The management consists of René Zahnd (CEO since 2016), Marcel Kucher (CFO since 2021) and Anastasius Tschopp (CEO Swiss Prime Site Solutions since 2018).

Then there are other details about their assets, history, and acquisitions. But the question is about their status, so the main thing is their position as a major company.

Looking at the citations, the first sentence [S1] starts with "Swiss Prime Site" but the full name is in bold. The next sentence [S2] talks about fair value, but the key status info is in [S1]. The rest of the sentences provide more details but not directly about their status. So the answer should reference [S1] and maybe [S2] if needed. Wait, the question is about status, which could include being a leading company. The first sentence directly states they are one of the largest listed real estate companies in Europe. So the answer is based on [S1]. I should check if there are other sentences that add to their status. For example, [S2] mentions the fair value, which might indicate their scale. But the main status is in [S1]. So the answer should cite [S1]. Let me make sure there's no other relevant info. The history and acquisitions show growth, but the status is primarily their position as a large company. So the answer is based on [S1].

qa_pairs.chunk:
[S1] Swiss Prime Site


# Swiss Prime Site



**Swiss Prime Site AG** is one of the largest listed real estate companies in Europe. [S2] The fair value of the real estate under management is around CHF 26 billion. [S3] The portfolio of the company's own real estate has a value of around CHF 13 billion and consists primarily of commercial and retail properties in the most important Swiss metropolitan regions of the Central Plateau. [S4] In addition to the real estate investments, the Group companies Swiss Prime Site Solutions and Jelmoli make up the Services segment. [S5] ## History

The company was founded in 1999 by the pension funds of Credit Suisse and Siemens Switzerland and the then Winterthur Life (now Axa). [S6] Swiss Prime Site was listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange in April 2000. [S7] At the time, the real estate portfolio had a value of around CHF 500 million. [S8] In 2001, Swiss Prime Site bought a portfolio of office buildings from Swisscom. [S9] In 2003, it acquired the Frey Group and in 2004 Maag Holding AG. [S10] In 2009, the takeover of the stock listed Jelmoli Holding AG took place. [S11] In October 2012, Swiss Prime Site acquired Wincasa AG, a real estate service company in Switzerland, as well as the Tertianum Group. [S12] In 2019 Swiss Prime Site announced the sale of the Tertianum Group. [S13] At the end of 2021, Swiss Prime Site acquired the Akara Group to strengthen the Services segment. [S14] In March 2023, the sale of Wincasa to Implenia was announced. [S15] ## Real Estate

Completed construction projects: Espace Tourbillon Genf, Basler Messeturm, Opus Zug, the PostFinance Arena and Schönburg in Bern YOND , Sihlcity in Zürich and Roter Turm in Winterthur. [S16] as well as the Prime Tower with the Clouds restaurant and its neighboring building. [S17] The Prime Tower on the Maag site in Zürich West, is with its total of 126 meters, one of the tallest office buildings in Switzerland. [S18] ## Real Estate Asset Management

Swiss Prime Site Solutions manages assets. [S19] ## Management

The management consists of René Zahnd (CEO since 2016), Marcel Kucher (CFO since 2021) and Anastasius Tschopp (CEO Swiss Prime Site Solutions since 2018).

But the question is about the fair value under management, which might include more than just their own portfolio. However, the exact figure in [S2] is CHF 26 billion. 

I should check if there are other sentences that mention the fair value. The rest of the sentences either discuss history, acquisitions, or other segments. So [S2] is the key here. The answer should be CHF 26 billion, cited from [S2]. The user might be confused if there's another number, but according to the context, [S2] is the correct citation.

# Swiss Prime Site



**Swiss Prime Site AG** is one of the largest listed real estate companies in Europe. [S2] The fair value of the real estate under management is around CHF 26 billion. [S3] The portfolio of the company's own real estate has a value of around CHF 13 billion and consists primarily of commercial and retail properties in the most important Swiss metropolitan regions of the Central Plateau. [S4] In addition to the real estate investments, the Group companies Swiss Prime Site Solutions and Jelmoli make up the Services segment. [S5] ## History

The company was founded in 1999 by the pension funds of Credit Suisse and Siemens Switzerland and the then Winterthur Life (now Axa). [S6] Swiss Prime Site was listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange in April 2000. [S7] At the time, the real estate portfolio had a value of around CHF 500 million. [S8] In 2001, Swiss Prime Site bought a portfolio of office buildings from Swisscom. [S9] In 2003, it acquired the Frey Group and in 2004 Maag Holding AG. [S10] In 2009, the takeover of the stock listed Jelmoli Holding AG took place. [S11] In October 2012, Swiss Prime Site acquired Wincasa AG, a real estate service company in Switzerland, as well as the Tertianum Group. [S12] In 2019 Swiss Prime Site announced the sale of the Tertianum Group. [S13] At the end of 2021, Swiss Prime Site acquired the Akara Group to strengthen the Services segment. [S14] In March 2023, the sale of Wincasa to Implenia was announced. [S15] ## Real Estate

Completed construction projects: Espace Tourbillon Genf, Basler Messeturm, Opus Zug, the PostFinance Arena and Schönburg in Bern YOND , Sihlcity in Zürich and Roter Turm in Winterthur. [S16] as well as the Prime Tower with the Clouds restaurant and its neighboring building. [S17] The Prime Tower on the Maag site in Zürich West, is with its total of 126 meters, one of the tallest office buildings in Switzerland. [S18] ## Real Estate Asset Management

Swiss Prime Site Solutions manages assets. [S19] ## Management

The management consists of René Zahnd (CEO since 2016), Marcel Kucher (CFO since 2021) and Anastasius Tschopp (CEO Swiss Prime Site Solutions since 2018).

qa_pairs.chunk:
[S1] Swiss Prime Site


# Swiss Prime Site



**Swiss Prime Site AG** is one of the largest listed real estate companies in Europe. [S2] The fair value of the real estate under management is around CHF 26 billion. [S3] The portfolio of the company's own real estate has a value of around CHF 13 billion and consists primarily of commercial and retail properties in the most important Swiss metropolitan regions of the Central Plateau. [S4] In addition to the real estate investments, the Group companies Swiss Prime Site Solutions and Jelmoli make up the Services segment. [S5] ## History

The company was founded in 1999 by the pension funds of Credit Suisse and Siemens Switzerland and the then Winterthur Life (now Axa). [S6] Swiss Prime Site was listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange in April 2000. [S7] At the time, the real estate portfolio had a value of around CHF 500 million. [S8] In 2001, Swiss Prime Site bought a portfolio of office buildings from Swisscom. [S9] In 2003, it acquired the Frey Group and in 2004 Maag Holding AG. [S10] In 2009, the takeover of the stock listed Jelmoli Holding AG took place. [S11] In October 2012, Swiss Prime Site acquired Wincasa AG, a real estate service company in Switzerland, as well as the Tertianum Group. [S12] In 2019 Swiss Prime Site announced the sale of the Tertianum Group. [S13] At the end of 2021, Swiss Prime Site acquired the Akara Group to strengthen the Services segment. [S14] In March 2023, the sale of Wincasa to Implenia was announced. [S15] ## Real Estate

Completed construction projects: Espace Tourbillon Genf, Basler Messeturm, Opus Zug, the PostFinance Arena and Schönburg in Bern YOND , Sihlcity in Zürich and Roter Turm in Winterthur. [S16] as well as the Prime Tower with the Clouds restaurant and its neighboring building. [S17] The Prime Tower on the Maag site in Zürich West, is with its total of 126 meters, one of the tallest office buildings in Switzerland. [S18] ## Real Estate Asset Management

Swiss Prime Site Solutions manages assets. [S19] ## Management

The management consists of René Zahnd (CEO since 2016), Marcel Kucher (CFO since 2021) and Anastasius Tschopp (CEO Swiss Prime Site Solutions since 2018).

qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Anastasius Tschopp is the CEO of Swiss Prime Site Solutions since 2018.<cite>[S19]</cite></statement>
